org.jdesktop.jdic.filetypes
Class Association

java.lang.Object
  org.jdesktop.jdic.filetypes.Association
public class Association
extends java.lang.Object

This class abstracts the cross-platform registration information for one file type.

The associated information includes description, mime type, file extensions, icon file name, and the corresponding action list.

Constructor Detail

Association

public Association()
Method Detail

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Returns the value of the name field.

The name field is the name of the generated or removed mime files on Gnome while registering/unregistering an association.

On Gnome, one association is stored in plain text files: *.mime, *.keys and *.applications. With this field, the files to be generated or removed would be .mime, .keys and .applications.

Notice: While registering/unregistering an association on Gnome, this field must be specified. But on Windows, it's unnecessary and never used.

Returns:
String

setName

public void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the value of the name field.

The name field is the name of the generated or removed mime files on Gnome while registering/unregistering an association.

On Gnome, one association is stored in plain text files: *.mime, *.keys and *.applications. With this field, the files to be generated or removed would be .mime, .keys and .applications.

Notice: While registering/unregistering an association on Gnome, this field must be specified. But on Windows, it's unnecessary and never used.

Parameters:
name - a given name value.

setMimeType

public void setMimeType(java.lang.String mimeType)
Sets the value of the mime type field.

Notice: A valid MIME type should be of the form class/type and contains no spaces. For example, "text/html".

Parameters:
mimeType - a given mime type.

addFileExtension

public boolean addFileExtension(java.lang.String fileExt)
Adds one file extension to the file extension list. If the given file extension already exists in the file extension list, it will return false, and no changes are made to the file extension list.

The specified file extension may have a leading '.' character or not. If it has no leading '.' character, the '.' will be added automatically.

On Windows Only the HEADER file extension will be effective during registration, i.e. the first added file extension will be the only one writing into registration table.

Parameters:
fileExt - a given file extension.
Returns:
true if the file extension list is changed as a result of the call.

removeFileExtension

public boolean removeFileExtension(java.lang.String fileExt)
Removes the given file extension from the file extension list. If the file extension is not contained in the file extension list, it will return false, no changes are made to the file extension list.

The specified file extension may have a leading '.' character or not. If it has no leading '.' character, the '.' will be added automatically.

Parameters:
fileExt - a given file extension.
Returns:
true if the given file extension is contained the file extension list and removed.

getFileExtList

public java.util.List getFileExtList()
Returns the file extension list

Returns:
file extension list of the association

getIconFileName

public java.lang.String getIconFileName()
Returns the value of the iconFileName field..

Returns:
icon file name for this association

setIconFileName

public void setIconFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
Sets the value of the iconFileName field.

Notice: On Windows

An association with icon file name set would be valid for registration only if the file extension list is not empty.

Parameters:
fileName - a given icon file name.

addAction

public boolean addAction(Action action)
Adds a given action to the action list. If the given action already exists in the action list, it will return false, and no changes are made to the action list.

Notice: A valid action should not have null verb or command field

On Windows

An association with none-empty action list would be valid for registration when the file extension list is not empty.

Parameters:
action - a given action.
Returns:
true if the action list is changed as a result of the call.

removeAction

public boolean removeAction(Action action)
Removes a given action from the action list. If the action is not contained in the action list, it will return false, and no changes are made to the action list.

Notice: A valid action should not have null verb or command field

Parameters:
action - a given action.
Returns:
true if the given action is contained the action list and removed.

getActionList

public java.util.List getActionList()
Returns the action list

Returns:
action list of the association

getActionByVerb

public Action getActionByVerb(java.lang.String verb)
Returns the action, whose verb field is the same with the specified verb. If such action does not exist, returns null.

Parameters:
verb - The specified verb
Returns:
the action with the specified verb.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
Overrides equals() method.

On Windows:

RegisterSystemAssociation and RegisterUserAssociation will only save the header file extension in the file extension list. The retrieved association (with only one file extension) may not be equal to the one registerd (with multiple file extensions in the file extension list)

Parameters:
other - reference for other object
Returns:
true if the specified Assoction object equals to this object.

Returns:
hashcode for this association object

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides toString() method. 
 The output of this object as a string would be like:

     MIME File Name:  
     Description:  
     MIME Type:  
     Icon File:  
     File Extension:  
     Action List:  
         Description:    
         Verb: 
         Command:

Returns:
String representation of this association
